page.title: 17HOW CLOUGH FARM
page.content: HOW CLOUGH FARM The only farm in this area now, is on Old Clough Lane. The farmer has lived there for 68 years and once had 60 head of cattle. Much of his land has now been bought to build houses on and he has few animals. The farm is mainly a dairy farm. Every day the farmer does a milk round, delivering milk to about 1000 houses. He doesn't use a milk float, but instead has two horses which pull two 4_wheel milk carts. He says this is easier and cheaper for him as his customers are close together. He sometimes keeps pigs and has 1000 hens which produce eggs. He sells these to his milk customers and callers to the farm. He doesn't grow crops but he has a tractor and haymaking machine. He keeps most of the hay for his two horses and sells any left over.
